00051 class ManyToOneFieldWidget(AbstractFieldWidget, ManyToOneFieldWidgetUi):
00052         def __init__(self, parent, model, attrs={}):
00053                 AbstractFieldWidget.__init__(self, parent, model, attrs)
00054                 ManyToOneFieldWidgetUi.__init__(self)
00055                 self.setupUi(self)
00056                 
00057                 self.uiText.installEventFilter( self )
00058                 self.connect( self.uiText, SIGNAL( "editingFinished()" ), self.match )
00059                 self.connect( self.pushNew, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.new )
00060                 self.connect( self.pushOpen, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.open )
00061                 self.connect( self.pushClear, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.clear )
00062 
00063                 # Create shortcuts
00064                 self.scNew = QShortcut( self.uiText )
00065                 self.scNew.setKey( Shortcuts.CreateInField )
00066                 self.scNew.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00067                 self.connect( self.scNew, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.new )
00068 
00069                 self.scSearch = QShortcut( self.uiText )
00070                 self.scSearch.setKey( Shortcuts.SearchInField )
00071                 self.scSearch.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00072                 self.connect( self.scSearch, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.open )
00073 
00074                 self.recordType = attrs['relation']     
00075                 # To build the menu entries we need to query the server so we only make 
00076                 # the call if necessary and only once. Hence with self.menuLoaded we know
00077                 # if we've got it in the 'cache'
00078                 self.menuLoaded = False
00079                 self.newMenuEntries = []
00080                 self.newMenuEntries.append((_('Action'), lambda: self.executeAction('client_action_multi'), False))
00081                 self.newMenuEntries.append((_('Report'), lambda: self.executeAction('client_print_multi'), False))
00082                 self.newMenuEntries.append((None, None, None))
00083 
00084                 if attrs.get('completion',False):
00085                         ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attrs['relation'], 'name_search', '', [], 'ilike', Rpc.session.context, False)
00086                         if ids:
00087                                 self.loadCompletion( ids, attrs )
00088 
00089         def clear( self ):
00090                 # As the 'clear' button might modify the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00091                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by modifying
00092                 # the parent model could make us lose changes.
00093                 self.view.store()
00094 
00095                 if self.record:
00096                         self.record.setValue( self.name, False )
00097                 self.uiText.clear()
00098                 self.pushOpen.setIcon( QIcon( ":/images/find.png"))
00099                 self.pushOpen.setToolTip( _("Search") )
00100 
00101         def loadCompletion(self,ids,attrs):
00102                 self.completion = QCompleter()
00103                 self.completion.setCaseSensitivity( Qt.CaseInsensitive )
00104                 self.uiText.setCompleter( self.completion )
00105                 liststore = []
00106                 for i,word in enumerate( ids ):
00107                         if word[1][0] == '[':
00108                                 i = word[1].find( ']')
00109                                 s = word[1][1:i]
00110                                 s2 = word[1][i+2:]
00111                                 liststore.append( s2 )
00112                         else:
00113                                 liststore.append( word[1] )
00114                 self.completion.setModel( QStringListModel( liststore ) )
00115                 self.completion.setCompletionColumn( 0 )
00116 
00117         def setReadOnly(self, value):
00118                 AbstractFieldWidget.setReadOnly(self, value)
00119                 self.uiText.setReadOnly( value )
00120                 self.pushNew.setEnabled( not value )
00121                 self.pushClear.setEnabled( not value )
00122                 if self.record and self.record.value(self.name):
00123                         self.pushOpen.setEnabled( True )
00124                 else:
00125                         self.pushOpen.setEnabled( not value )
00126 
00127         def colorWidget(self):
00128                 return self.uiText
00129 
00130         def match(self):
00131                 if not self.record:
00132                         return
00133                 name = unicode( self.uiText.text() )
00134                 if name.strip() == '':
00135                         self.record.setValue( self.name, False )                        
00136                         self.showValue()
00137                         return
00138                 if name == self.record.value(self.name):
00139                         return
00140                 self.search( name )
00141 
00142         def open(self):
00143                 # As the 'open' button might modify the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00144                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by modifying
00145                 # the parent model could make us lose changes.
00146                 self.view.store()
00147 
00148                 if self.record.value(self.name):
00149                         # If Control Key is pressed when the open button is clicked
00150                         # the record will be opened in a new tab. Otherwise it's opened
00151                         # in a new modal dialog.
00152                         if QApplication.keyboardModifiers() & Qt.ControlModifier:
00153                                 model = self.attrs['relation']
00154                                 id = self.record.get()[self.name]
00155                                 if QApplication.keyboardModifiers() & Qt.ShiftModifier:
00156                                         target = 'background'
00157                                 else:
00158                                         target = 'current'
00159                                 Api.instance.createWindow(False, model, id, [], 'form', mode='form,tree', target=target)
00160                         else:   
00161                                 dialog = ScreenDialog( self )
00162                                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attrs )
00163                                 dialog.setup( self.attrs['relation'], self.record.get()[self.name] )
00164                                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00165                                         self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00166                                         self.display()
00167                 else:
00168                         self.search('')
00169 
00170         # This function searches the given name within the available records. If none or more than
00171         # one possible name matches the search dialog is shown. If only one matches we set the
00172         # value and don't even show the search dialog. This is also true if the function is called
00173         # with "name=''" and only one record exists in the database (hence the call from open())
00174         def search(self, name):
00175                 domain = self.record.domain( self.name )
00176                 context = self.record.fieldContext( self.name )
00177                 ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attrs['relation'], 'name_search', name, domain, 'ilike', context, False)
00178                 if ids and len(ids)==1:
00179                         self.record.setValue( self.name, ids[0] )
00180                         self.display()
00181                 else:
00182                         dialog = SearchDialog(self.attrs['relation'], sel_multi=False, ids=[x[0] for x in ids], context=context, domain=domain, parent=self)
00183                         if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted and dialog.result:
00184                                 id = dialog.result[0]
00185                                 name = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attrs['relation'], 'name_get', [id], context)[0]
00186                                 self.record.setValue(self.name, name)
00187                                 self.display()
00188 
00189         def new(self):
00190                 dialog = ScreenDialog(self)
00191                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attrs )
00192                 dialog.setContext( self.record.fieldContext( self.name ) )
00193                 dialog.setDomain( self.record.domain(self.name) )
00194                 dialog.setup( self.attrs['relation'] )
00195                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00196                         self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00197                         self.display()
00198 
00199         def store(self):
00200                 if self.uiText.hasFocus():
00201                         # Ensure match() is executed. Otherwise clicking on save() while the cursor
00202                         # is on the widget doesn't behave as expected and returns the field to its 
00203                         # previous value.
00204                         self.match()
00205 
00206         def reset(self):
00207                 self.uiText.clear()
00208                 
00209         def showValue(self):
00210                 res = self.record.value(self.name)
00211                 if res:
00212                         self.uiText.setText( res )
00213                         self.uiText.setCursorPosition( 0 )
00214                         self.pushOpen.setIcon( QIcon( ":/images/folder.png"))
00215                         self.pushOpen.setToolTip( _("Open") )
00216                         # pushOpen will always be enabled if it has to open an existing
00217                         # element
00218                         self.pushOpen.setEnabled( True )
00219                 else:
00220                         self.uiText.clear()
00221                         self.pushOpen.setIcon( QIcon( ":/images/find.png"))
00222                         self.pushOpen.setToolTip( _("Search") )
00223                         # pushOpen won't be enabled if it is to find an element
00224                         self.pushOpen.setEnabled( not self.isReadOnly() )
00225 
00226         def menuEntries(self):
00227                 if not self.menuLoaded:
00228                         related = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.values', 'get', 'action', 'client_action_relate', [(self.recordType, False)], False, Rpc.session.context)
00229                         actions = [x[2] for x in related]
00230                         for action in actions:
00231                                 f = lambda action: lambda: self.executeRelation(action)
00232                                 self.newMenuEntries.append(('... '+ action['name'], f(action), False))
00233                         self.menuLoaded = True
00234 
00235                 # Set enabled/disabled values
00236                 value = self.record.value(self.name)
00237                 if value:
00238                         value = True
00239                 else:
00240                         value = False
00241                 currentEntries = []
00242                 for x in self.newMenuEntries:
00243                         currentEntries.append( (x[0], x[1], value) )
00244                 return currentEntries
00245 
00246         def executeRelation(self, action):
00247                 id = self.record.get()[self.name]
00248                 group = RecordGroup( self.attrs['relation'] )
00249                 group.load( [id] )
00250                 record = group.modelByIndex( 0 )
00251                 action['domain'] = record.evaluateExpression( action['domain'], checkLoad=False)
00252                 action['context'] = str( record.evaluateExpression( action['context'], checkLoad=False) )
00253                 Api.instance.executeAction( action )
00254 
00255         def executeAction(self, type):
00256                 id = self.record.id
00257                 Api.instance.executeKeyword(type, {'model':self.recordType, 'id': id or False, 'ids':[id], 'report_type': 'pdf'})
00258 
00259 class ManyToOneFieldDelegate( AbstractFieldDelegate ):
00260         def __init__(self, parent, attributes):
00261                 AbstractFieldDelegate.__init__(self, parent, attributes)
00262                 self.currentEditor = None
00263                 self.currentValue = None
00264                 self.recordType = attributes['relation']        
00265 
00266         def menuEntries(self, record):
00267                 newMenuEntries = []
00268                 newMenuEntries.append((_('Action'), lambda: self.executeAction(record, 'client_action_multi'), False))
00269                 newMenuEntries.append((_('Report'), lambda: self.executeAction(record, 'client_print_multi'), False))
00270                 newMenuEntries.append((None, None, None))
00271                 related = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.values', 'get', 'action', 'client_action_relate', [(self.recordType, False)], False, Rpc.session.context)
00272                 actions = [x[2] for x in related]
00273                 for action in actions:
00274                         f = lambda action: lambda: self.executeRelation(record, action)
00275                         newMenuEntries.append(('... '+ action['name'], f(action), False))
00276 
00277                 # Set enabled/disabled values
00278                 value = record.value(self.name)
00279                 if value:
00280                         value = True
00281                 else:
00282                         value = False
00283                 currentEntries = []
00284                 for x in newMenuEntries:
00285                         currentEntries.append( (x[0], x[1], value) )
00286                 return currentEntries
00287 
00288         def executeRelation(self, record, action):
00289                 id = record.get()[self.name]
00290                 group = RecordGroup( self.attributes['relation'] )
00291                 group.load( [id] )
00292                 record = group.modelByIndex( 0 )
00293                 action['domain'] = record.evaluateExpression( action['domain'], checkLoad=False)
00294                 action['context'] = str( record.evaluateExpression( action['context'], checkLoad=False) )
00295                 Api.instance.executeAction( action )
00296 
00297         def executeAction(self, record, type):
00298                 id = record.id
00299                 Api.instance.executeKeyword(type, {'model':self.recordType, 'id': id or False, 'ids':[id], 'report_type': 'pdf'})
00300 
00301         def createEditor(self, parent, option, index):
00302                 widget = AbstractFieldDelegate.createEditor(self, parent, option, index)
00303                 if widget:
00304                         # Create shortcuts
00305                         self.scNew = QShortcut( widget )
00306                         self.scNew.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00307                         self.scNew.setKey( Shortcuts.CreateInField )
00308                         self.connect( self.scNew, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.new )
00309 
00310                         self.scSearch = QShortcut( widget )
00311                         self.scSearch.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00312                         self.scSearch.setKey( Shortcuts.SearchInField )
00313                         self.connect( self.scSearch, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.open )
00314                 self.currentEditor = widget
00315                 # We expect a KooModel here
00316                 self.record = index.model().recordFromIndex( index )
00317                 return widget
00318 
00319         def open(self):
00320                 # As the 'open' button might modify the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00321                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by modifying
00322                 # the parent model could make us lose changes.
00323                 #self.view.store()
00324 
00325                 if self.record.value(self.name):
00326                         # If Control Key is pressed when the open button is clicked
00327                         # the record will be opened in a new tab. Otherwise it's opened
00328                         # in a new modal dialog.
00329                         if QApplication.keyboardModifiers() & Qt.ControlModifier:
00330                                 model = self.attributes['relation']
00331                                 id = self.record.get()[self.name]
00332                                 Api.instance.createWindow(False, model, id, [], 'form', mode='form,tree')
00333                         else:   
00334                                 dialog = ScreenDialog( self.currentEditor )
00335                                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attributes )
00336                                 dialog.setup( self.attributes['relation'], self.record.get()[self.name] )
00337                                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00338                                         self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00339                 else:
00340                         self.search('')
00341 
00342         # This function searches the given name within the available records. If none or more than
00343         # one possible name matches the search dialog is shown. If only one matches we set the
00344         # value and don't even show the search dialog. This is also true if the function is called
00345         # with "name=''" and only one record exists in the database (hence the call from open())
00346         def search(self, name):
00347                 domain = self.record.domain( self.name )
00348                 context = self.record.context()
00349                 ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_search', name, domain, 'ilike', context, False)
00350                 if ids and len(ids)==1:
00351                         self.record.setValue( self.name, ids[0] )
00352                 else:
00353                         dialog = SearchDialog(self.attributes['relation'], sel_multi=False, ids=[x[0] for x in ids], context=context, domain=domain)
00354                         if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted and dialog.result:
00355                                 id = dialog.result[0]
00356                                 name = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_get', [id], Rpc.session.context)[0]
00357                                 self.record.setValue(self.name, name)
00358 
00359         def new(self):
00360                 dialog = ScreenDialog( self.currentEditor )
00361                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attributes )
00362                 dialog.setContext( self.record.fieldContext( self.name ) )
00363                 dialog.setDomain( self.record.domain(self.name) )
00364                 dialog.setup( self.attributes['relation'] )
00365                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00366                         self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00367 
00368         def setModelData(self, editor, kooModel, index):
00369                 # We expect a KooModel here
00370                 model = kooModel.recordFromIndex( index )
00371 
00372                 if not unicode(editor.text()):
00373                         model.setValue( self.name, False )
00374                         return
00375 
00376                 if unicode( kooModel.data( index, Qt.DisplayRole ).toString() ) == unicode( editor.text() ):
00377                         return
00378 
00379                 domain = model.domain( self.name )
00380                 context = model.context()
00381                 ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_search', unicode( editor.text() ), domain, 'ilike', context, False)
00382                 if ids and len(ids)==1:
00383                         model.setValue( self.name, ids[0] )
00384                 else:
00385                         dialog = SearchDialog(self.attributes['relation'], sel_multi=False, ids=[x[0] for x in ids], context=context, domain=domain)
00386                         if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted and dialog.result:
00387                                 id = dialog.result[0]
00388                                 name = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_get', [id], Rpc.session.context)[0]
00389                                 
00390                                 # Directly set the value to the model. There's no need to
00391                                 # use setData() but we mainly want to workaround a bug in
00392                                 # PyQt 4.4.3 and 4.4.4.
00393                                 #value = [ QVariant( name[0] ), QVariant( name[1] ) ]
00394                                 #kooModel.setData( index, QVariant( value ), Qt.EditRole )
00395                                 model.setValue( self.name, name )
